page.title: 06A shopping centre-St.Helens
page.content: The{Hardshaw Centre}is one of the most modern shopping centres in the country.As you walk in from Chuch Street there is a big sign-it says 'The Hardshaw Centre'. The floor is made of marble,and on the walls there is a picture of the old Greenall's Brewery where they used to make beer.The Centre is on the old Greenall's site. Inside the Centre there is a wooden snake called KES (Kid Eating Snake);it is hollow so you can crawl through it.You go through the mouth and out through the tail. The Centre is well-planned.Boots and Marks & Spencer were already and the Centre joined on to them. On top of the Centre there is a carpark which has a capacity of 500 cars,and if you buy over Â£3 of food at Presto's you get a free parking token.
